What the fuck are you talking about? Power? It's called common sense. 
If I see I'm wrong, I'll step down on my pride and admit so. That's 
the whole point of it. If you ask me to justify my point, I'll gladly 
do so, and I know both Rauq and Rudra would do the same.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> And I'm saying moderators find it endagering to their
> power to back down, or admit they were wrong so don't
> bother arguing.
> 
> --- cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...>
> > wrote:
> > > Cardhead, When Azure suggested you hold your
> > posting, you should 
> > > hold your posting. He's not a moderator just so he
> > can stand around 
> > > and look pretty. Moderators are to be listened
> > too, that way 
> > > mistakes or misconceptions can be picked up and
> > fixed before 
> > > anything disasterous happens (we hope anyway). =)
> > 
> > Whoah, way to point your finger in the wrong
> > direction.  The only 
> > posts I made that had anything to do with the battle
> > in the last 
> > couple of days were to clarify the weapon's
> > function.  It's not like 
> > I kept shooting!  Jeez, just because you're a mod
> > doesn't mean you 
> > automatically know everything about a weapon someone
> > else designed.
> > 
> > I'm not here to stand around and look pretty either.
> >  If anyone needs 
> > an attitude change, it's the people who expect the
> > new guy to not 
> > know shit about how RPGs work.  I've had a ton of
> > writing and 
> > roleplaying experience, thank you very much, and I
> > know what I'm 
> > doing.
> > 
> > You ought to be a little more prepared for those who
> > show up with a 
> > slew of ideas ready beforehand.  I'm not saying all
> > my ideas should 
> > go through, I'm saying I have them ready for when
> > there's an opening.
> > 
> >
